revised_title: Separation and Analysis of Normal Paraffins and Their Chlorides
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on normal paraffins and their chlorides, specifically heptane from Pinus Sabiniana. They discovered that not all chlorides indicated by theory are formed, but only primary and secondary chlorides containing the group CHC1.CH3. This challenges the idea that hydrochloric acid can separate isomeric paraffins.
